application_type_full: Tree works: Trees in conservation areas/subject to TPOs
description: T1 Lime - Crown Lift up to 7m AGL, Crown this 25%, Remove DWS & Epicormic growth from upper trunk, Trim back lateral spread on the East side branches at 8m AGL shortening length by 3m , reducing back to the previous points of lateral reduction and feathering in to leave natural crown shape, Cut back to clear neighbours building by 2.5m. Tree with longitudinal cavity running up western side of trunk from ground level up to 1.4m AGL.(consent had previously already been given for CR50% but this work was not implemented and this specification is for lesser works to deal with shading issues and canopy touching neighbours building)T2 & T3 Himalayan Birches - Fell to ground level, poison and remove stumps.Trees are young specimens, still with stakes on them, part of a garden feature no longer required the area small trees with DBH's 84mm and 92mm respectively. To be replaced by new trees in nearby location in boundary shrub bedsT4 Wild Plum - Fell to ground level, poison and remove stumpSmall tree twin stemmed from base, poor quality sparse crown with extensive peach leaf curl. To be replaced by new trees in nearby location.T5 Quince - Fell to ground level, poison and remove stumpSmall tree twin stemmed from base, poor quality sparse crown with extensive peach leaf curl. To be replaced by new trees in nearby location.Tree T1 to T5 are all rear garden trees.T6 Hornbeam - Front Garden tree - Re-Shape by Re-reducing all over dimensions, lifting lower branches to provide increased clearanceSmall Pleached/Box Pruned specimen which is regularly pruned.
